body: Which of the following is not a part of the endomembrane system?
What kind of microtubule arrangement characterizes mature basal bodies?
A car has velocity 5 m/s. A truck is driving in the same direction as the car at 10 m/s. To the car driver, who perceives herself as stationary, how fast, in meters per second is the truck moving?
A car drives north at 6 m/s, and a truck drives west at 8 m/s. After how many seconds will they be 50 meters apart?
What element on the Periodic Table has the highest first ionization energy?
Which of the following elements has the highest electron affinity?
Charlie sells pizzas in groups of 5 and 9. What is the maximum number of pizzas he cannot sell?
Let $\athrm{n} = 3\athrm{x} + 7\athrm{y}$, where $\athrm{x}$ and $\athrm{y}$ are integers. Which of the following can $\athrm{n}$ not be?
At which of the following locations on an HR diagram would you expect to see a blue giant?
RR Lyrae stars can be found on what part of the HR diagram?
Researchers at Ames National Laboratory are studying methods to separate rare-earth metals. Which of the following is not a rare Earth metal?

Researchers at Pacific Northwest National Laboratories are studying the effects of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere. Rank the following three gases in terms of increasing root mean squared speed, given that they are all at the same temperature: 1) Hydrogen Chloride 2) Krypton 3) Argon
Which of the following is not a base SI unit of measure?

Isaac throws a ball at 10 meters per second at a 30 degree angle from the ground, and Brandon simultaneously throws a ball at 5 meters per second at a 60 degree angle from the horizontal. Which ball will hit the ground first?

choices.W: Isaac's ball will hit the ground before Brandon's ball
choices.X: Brandon's ball will hit the ground before Isaac's ball
choices.Y: The two balls will hit the ground at the same time

answer: X) BRANDON'S BALL WILL HIT THE GROUND BEFORE ISAAC'S BALL

body: The number of possible microstates of a system is related to the macroscopic entropy of that system by what constant?
A reaction is spontaneous at low temperatures and non-spontaneous at high temperatures. Which of the following must be the signs of delta H and delta S, respectively?
What bonds link glycerol to fatty acids in a triglyceride?
Ramachandran plots detailing the energetically allowed regions for the angles phi and psi deal mostly with what kind of chemical interaction?
It is currently 11:59 AM. What time would it be in 138 hours?
What is the sum of the infinite geometric series with second term 4 and third term 2?
By name or number, order the following 4 sediments by diameter from largest to smallest: 1) Clay; 2) Gravel; 3) Silt; 4) Sand.
What is the name of ocean sediment derived from space?
Researchers at SLAC National Lab are studying kinematics at high energy. Which of the following quantities is not part of a kinematic equation?
Researchers at Oak Ridge National Lab are creating programs to model kinematics. When plotted against time, the graph of what quantity will have a slope of velocity?
What are the two kinds of deaths that cells can undergo?
Which of the following is closest to the percentage of transposons in the human body in accordance with all cells?
Acetic acid, with pKa 4.7, is titrated with sodium hydroxide. Which of the following is closest to the pH of the solution at the equivalence point?
A 50 milliliter sample of phosphoric acid is titrated with 30 mL of 3 molar sulfuric acid. What is the molarity of the sample of the phosphoric acid?
A mass M produces a gravitational field around it. What best describes the gravitational field vector at a point outside of the mass?

choices.W: A vector which points towards the closest point on the surface of M
choices.Y: A vector which points directly away from the center of mass
choices.Z: A vector which points directly towards the center of mass

answer: Z) A VECTOR WHICH POINTS DIRECTLY TOWARDS THE CENTER OF MASS

body: By name or number, identify all of the following 3 quantities that are necessarily zero in an inertial frame of reference: 1) Net force; 2) Velocity; 3) Total Energy.
What is the equation of the line through the points (3, 4) and (5, 3)?
In standard form, what is the equation of the line perpendicular to $y = 3x + 5$ through the point (1, 8)?
IC 1101, the largest currently known galaxy, is an example of what type of galaxy?
In contrast to flocculent galaxies, what type of galaxies have well-defined spiral arms?
Researchers at Los Alamos National Laboratory are studying protein folding and unfolding. On what level of protein folding are zinc fingers found in?

Researchers at Los Alamos National Laboratory are analysing amino acid sequences in certain proteins. What amino acid does glutamic acid mutate into on residue 6 of beta hemoglobin, causing sickle cell anemia?
If thirteen fructose molecules were joined together through dehydration reactions, what would be the resulting compound?
In cellular respiration, what is the name of the compound the iron-sulfur protein in complex I passes electrons to?
While on Earth's surface, Bob exerts a force of 500 Newtons on the Earth. If the Earth is exactly $10^{23}$ times more massive than Bob, how much force does the Earth exert on Bob, in newtons?
What shape does the orbit of an orbiting body take, given that the orbiting body has a velocity strictly greater than the escape velocity of the body it orbits?
The conversion of carbon-14 to nitrogen-14 is an example of which of the following types of radioactive decay?
By name or number, identify all of the following 4 particles that are released in beta-plus decay: 1) Electron; 2) Positron; 3) Neutrino; 4) Antineutrino.
In an earthquake, what is the name of the point where waves originate?
By name or number, order the following 4 kinds of waves from slowest to fastest: 1) L-waves; 2) P-waves; 3) S-waves; 4) R-waves.
What is the area of an equilateral triangle with side length 2?
By name or number, identify all of the following 4 shapes that always have at least 2 lines of symmetry: 1) Rectangle; 2) Kite; 3) Circle; 4) Regular heptagon.
